projects.title: making payments in a novel way
personal vr stores
projects.body: Use machine learning to create intelligent and personalized VR stores.

projects.title: casual games
projects.body: Create a casual game for short play sessions. Mobile VR has yet to have its Candy Crush.

projects.title: side effects
projects.body: Use VR videos to help doctors to explain the possible side effects of treatment.

projects.title: indoor exercises
projects.body: VR headsets can help ceate fun indoor exercises to prevent ergonomics. We could even learn certain sports using VR headsets.

projects.title: relaxing environment
projects.body: Create an enjoyable and relaxing environment for meditation, yoga, etc.

projects.title: emergency situations
projects.body: Simulate emergency situations in surgeries to help young doctors get trained and to build up teamwok inside a medical team.

projects.title: power dynamic
projects.body: Develop an app that can support multiple users and simulate a teacher/student power dynamic. For example, let only the teacher write on a virtual chalkboard.

projects.title: history
projects.body: Immerse yourself in a specific historical period.

projects.title: visualize 3D models
projects.body: Visualize complex, 3D models from the outside and inside.

projects.title: homework
projects.body: Hand in certain types of homework through VR. These could be presentations or interviews.

projects.title: guest speakers
projects.body: Allow more virtual guest speakers and auditors in a class.

projects.title: real-time visualization
projects.body: Create a real-time visualization of sports games without live video and instead using live updated statistics or commentary.

projects.title: architecture
projects.body: Be able to see a building's exterior, interior, or both. Change pieces in real time.

projects.title: data visualization
projects.body: It's hard to find VR data visualizations that really utilize the medium well. In other words, we need more specific examples of data visualization that are improved by using VR over a 2D screen.

projects.title: VR scenes
projects.body: Build and animate VR scenes in VR.

projects.title: creation <> printing
projects.body: Combin 3D creation with 3D printing.

projects.title: high replayability
projects.body: Create very short experiences with high replayability (i.e. lots of stuff going on).

projects.title: advertising
projects.body: How can VR advetising be different, more impactful, and less intrusive than current ads?

projects.title: advanced graphics
projects.body: Most VR experiences use either no physics or rigid objects only. Try an advanced graphics concept like fluids, hair, or cloth.

projects.title: dangerous missions
projects.body: VR glasses can help to identify objects and share views of different soldiers on particularly dangerous missions.

projects.title: anxiety/autism
projects.body: Help those with anxiety and autism become more comfortable in social situations.

projects.title: business cards
projects.body: AR glasses with personal information can be used as business cards. It lets people build up information about their social network.

projects.title: long-distance
projects.body: Allow people living far away to have VR chat. Make long distance relationships easier and help families gather together during the holidays.

projects.title: locomotion
projects.body: Long-distance locomotion! Teleportation is the current de facto but it's cumbersome.

projects.title: body
projects.body: Be able to visualize all or part of your body.

projects.title: avoiding the uncanny valley
projects.body: VR comes with the concept of the uncanny valley, positing that near-replicas of human beings that aren't exact make some observers feel eerie or revolted. How can we revamp artificially intelligent avatars in VR to avoid this?

projects.title: eye-tracking
projects.body: Create a VR eye-tracking interface.

projects.title: public space
projects.body: How can we make people feel more comfortable using VR in a public space (socially and safety-wise)?

projects.title: voice recognition
projects.body: How might we improve VR environment interaction using voice recognition?

projects.title: different sight
projects.body: What if, when you and a friend are both in the same VR space, you see different things?
